description: This file is a shell script that sets up and manages a MySQL database server, applies migrations and seed data, and launches a database visualizer tool. It includes functions for waiting on TCP ports, running SQL files, handling MySQL startup, configuration, and migration processes, as well as starting a visualizer via npm.

methods.name: wait_for_tcp
methods.description: Helper function to wait until a TCP port on a host is open, with retries and delays.

methods.name: run_sql_file
methods.description: Helper function to execute an SQL file using available connection methods.

methods.name: apply_migrations
methods.description: Function to apply database migrations in order, tracking applied migrations to avoid repeats.

methods.name: apply_seed
methods.description: Function to seed initial data into the database if not already seeded.
